main event: On the night of 26 February 1954, an unidentified flying object was sighted near Columbus, Ohio. The object appeared to be stationary before moving closer and descending to a lower altitude.
interesting points: The object initially looked like a star, then appeared cylindrical and was estimated to be the size of a medium aircraft., The object had a round white light with a light green halo, and two red lights underneath that formed a V shape., The sighting lasted for 5-7 minutes before the object disappeared at high speed., The witness and his wife initially thought it was a weather balloon but ruled that out after closer examination., The report concluded the sighting could have been an aircraft due to its characteristics and nearby air activity.
